ctx: intros Q a b H p q H0 H1.
exceptions.exn: In environment A : Set A0, A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA, multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b} os : OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n) Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) a, b : Term A n H : eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) (ppc A1 (n:=n) a b) (multTerm multA (n:=n) a b) p, q : list (Term A n) H0 : inPolySet A A0 eqA n ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) Q H1 : canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) Unable to unify "reduceplus ?M2280 ?M2281 ?M2282 ?M2283 ?M2285 ?M2286 ?M2287 ?M2288 ?M2290 ?M2291 ?M2292 ?M2293 ?M2295 (mults ?M2287 ?M2296 ?M2297) (mults ?M2287 ?M2296 ?M2298)" with "reduceplus A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (minuspf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (mults multA (n:=n) b p) (mults multA (n:=n) a q)) (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) (multpf A A0 eqA plusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) q))".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (a b : Term A n), eqT (A:=A) (n:=n) (ppc A1 (n:=n) a b) (multTerm multA (n:=n) a b) -> forall p q : list (Term A n), inPolySet A A0 eqA n ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) Q -> canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) -> reduceplus A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q (minuspf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (mults multA (n:=n) b p) (mults multA (n:=n) a q)) (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) (multpf A A0 eqA plusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) q))

```coq
intros Q a b H p q H0 H1. apply reduceplus_mults; assumption.
Qed.```

original: intros Q a b H p q H0 H1. apply reduceplus_mults; auto.
